conclusion: To determine which car has greater acceleration, analyze the graph of the square of their velocities with respect to displacement.
The x-axis represents displacement in meters.
The y-axis represents the square of the velocity in meters per square second squared.
For Car A, at x = 0.5 m, the velocity squared is 2 m²/s².
For Car A, at x = 0.5 m, the velocity squared is 1 m²/s².
For Car B, at x = 0.5 m, the velocity squared is 2 m²/s².
For Car B, at x = 0.5 m, the velocity squared is 1 m²/s².
For Car A, the difference in velocity squared is 1 m²/s².
For Car B, the difference in velocity squared is 1 m²/s².
